title: Get started with pRycollection
text: can install development version pRycollection GitHub :

title: Get started with pRycollection
text: Choose available dataset package: Choose dataset print first six rows… might noticed dataset looks like normal dataset, however, additional meta data. additional meta data added dataset R package. example, observe author, year, title, reference dataset. new data frames stored R native format avoid loss meta data keep data meta data together. example, interested unit measure avg_temp variable, type following line code: can see unit measure “degrees Celsius”.
code: # you will see a new pane tab with the available datasets data(package = "pRycollection") head(py_temperature) #> Schneider (2025): Weekly mean temperature data [dataset], https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.16729963 #>   rowid     country   ISO       city         week       avg_temp  holiday    #>   <defined> <defined> <defined> <defined>    <dttm_dfn> <defined> <defined> #> 1 obs:1     Paraguay  PY        1 [Asuncion] 2016-01-04 27.8      0         #> 2 obs:2     Paraguay  PY        1 [Asuncion] 2016-01-11 30.3      0         #> 3 obs:3     Paraguay  PY        1 [Asuncion] 2016-01-18 29.9      0         #> 4 obs:4     Paraguay  PY        1 [Asuncion] 2016-01-25 27.3      1         #> 5 obs:5     Paraguay  PY        1 [Asuncion] 2016-02-01 26.6      0         #> 6 obs:6     Paraguay  PY        1 [Asuncion] 2016-02-08 30.1      0 attributes(py_temperature$avg_temp) #> $label #> [1] "Mean temperature" #>  #> $class #> [1] "haven_labelled_defined" "haven_labelled"         "vctrs_vctr"             #> [4] "double"                 #>  #> $unit #> [1] "degrees Celsius"  # or alternatively # attributes(py_temperature[[6]])

title: Authors and Citation
text: Andreas Schneider. Maintainer, data manager.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Schneider (2025). pRycollection: Diverse datasets Paraguay. R package version 0.0.1, https://github.com/schneiderpy/pRycollection/. Schneider (2025). “pRydata: Diverse datasets Paraguay.” doi:10.5281/zenodo.16729963.

title: Diverse Datasets from Paraguay
text: Datasets enriched metadata main goal pRycollection provide datasets Paraguay research teaching easily found accessible. pRycollection combination 3-letter code Paraguay - PRY - word collection. 3-letter code chosen avoid possible confusion programming language Python (py).

title: Diverse Datasets from Paraguay
text: can install development version pRycollection GitHub :

title: Diverse Datasets from Paraguay
text: pRycollection data package build beginning FAIR principles mind. FAIR stands Findable, Accessible, Interoperable, Reusable. principles critical maximizing impact value data research practice. data hosted Zenodo see datasets included package load pRycollection data package dataset package (access meta data). type following code line: open new tab source pane listing available datasets. Available datasets

title: Diverse Datasets from Paraguay
text: basic example shows use pRycollection. Let’s use py_temperature dataset. summary choosen dataset. first six rows dataset … … dimensions dataset …
code: summary(py_temperature) #> Schneider (2025): Summary of Weekly mean temperature data [dataset], https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.16729963 #>  #> Country name #> Country ISO code #> Mean temperature (degrees Celsius) #> Holiday indicator #>     rowid             country              ISO                 city   #>  Length:1565        Length:1565        Length:1565        Min.   :1   #>  Class :character   Class :character   Class :character   1st Qu.:2   #>  Mode  :character   Mode  :character   Mode  :character   Median :3   #>                                                           Mean   :3   #>                                                           3rd Qu.:4   #>                                                           Max.   :5   #>       week               avg_temp         holiday       #>  Min.   :2016-01-04   Min.   : 9.329   Min.   :0.0000   #>  1st Qu.:2017-07-03   1st Qu.:20.043   1st Qu.:0.0000   #>  Median :2018-12-31   Median :24.214   Median :0.0000   #>  Mean   :2018-12-31   Mean   :23.280   Mean   :0.1885   #>  3rd Qu.:2020-06-29   3rd Qu.:26.529   3rd Qu.:0.0000   #>  Max.   :2021-12-27   Max.   :32.000   Max.   :1.0000 head(py_temperature) #> Schneider (2025): Weekly mean temperature data [dataset], https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.16729963 #>   rowid     country   ISO       city         week       avg_temp  holiday    #>   <defined> <defined> <defined> <defined>    <dttm_dfn> <defined> <defined> #> 1 obs:1     Paraguay  PY        1 [Asuncion] 2016-01-04 27.8      0         #> 2 obs:2     Paraguay  PY        1 [Asuncion] 2016-01-11 30.3      0         #> 3 obs:3     Paraguay  PY        1 [Asuncion] 2016-01-18 29.9      0         #> 4 obs:4     Paraguay  PY        1 [Asuncion] 2016-01-25 27.3      1         #> 5 obs:5     Paraguay  PY        1 [Asuncion] 2016-02-01 26.6      0         #> 6 obs:6     Paraguay  PY        1 [Asuncion] 2016-02-08 30.1      0 dim(py_temperature) #> [1] 1565    7

title: Diverse Datasets from Paraguay
text: cite pRycollection package datasets, please use:
code: citation("pRycollection") #> To cite pRycollection in publications please use: #>  #>   Schneider A (2025). _pRycollection: Diverse datasets from Paraguay_. #>   R package version 0.0.1, #>   <https://github.com/schneiderpy/pRycollection/>. #>  #> Please also cite the related data package: #>  #>   Schneider A (2025). "pRydata: Diverse datasets from Paraguay." #>   doi:10.5281/zenodo.16729963 #>   <https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.16729963>. #>  #> To see these entries in BibTeX format, use 'print(<citation>, #> bibtex=TRUE)', 'toBibtex(.)', or set #> 'options(citation.bibtex.max=999)'.

what: pRycollection: Diverse Datasets from Paraguay — pRycollection-package
title: pRycollection: Diverse Datasets from Paraguay — pRycollection-package
text: dataset contains variety datasets different scientific fields, e.g., crime, healthcare, finance, weather, others. datasets include national data, others cover five largest Paraguayan cities.

title: pRycollection: Diverse Datasets from Paraguay — pRycollection-package
text: Maintainer: Andreas Schneider schneiderconsultingpy@gmail.com (ORCID) [data manager]

what: Large Credit Cooperatives of Paraguay — py_creditcoops
title: Large Credit Cooperatives of Paraguay — py_creditcoops
text: py_creditcoops data frame 44 rows 3 recorded columns. observations total loans granted large Paraguayan credit cooperatives (Type ) paired years 2016 2018. data set used published paper analyzing Paraguay's large credit cooperatives.

title: Large Credit Cooperatives of Paraguay — py_creditcoops
Large Credit Cooperatives of Paraguay — py_creditcoops
text: data frame 44 rows 6 variables: rowid index country Country name ISO Country ISO code coop_id Unique identifier cooperative year factor indicating year loan granted total_loans numeric variable indicating total loans granted US dollars

title: Large Credit Cooperatives of Paraguay — py_creditcoops
text: National Cooperative Institute (INCOOP). https://www.incoop.gov.py/

title: Large Credit Cooperatives of Paraguay — py_creditcoops
text: respective credit unions deliberately named, however, can requested author.

title: Large Credit Cooperatives of Paraguay — py_creditcoops
text: Schneider, . (2022).Kreditgenossenschaften: Marktstruktur, Wettbewerb und Verhalten. Das Beispiel Paraguay, Zeitschrift für das gesamte Genossenschaftswesen, 72, 7-38, https://doi.org/10.1515/zfgg-2022-0002.

title: All-cause mortality data — py_deathcauses
text: py_deathcauses data frame 2520 rows 3 recorded columns. observations counts 21 disease categories national level years 2013 2022. data set used published paper analyzing -cause mortality first total lockdown COVID-19 pandemic era.

title: All-cause mortality data — py_deathcauses
text: data frame 2520 rows 6 variables: rowid index country Country name ISO Country ISO code date Date variable %Y-%m-%d format category character string disease counts numeric variable indicating total counts given disease given time period

title: All-cause mortality data — py_deathcauses
text: Ministry Public Health Welfare (MSPBS). https://www.mspbs.gov.py/index.php

title: All-cause mortality data — py_deathcauses
text: Schneider, . (2024).impact COVID-19 pandemic -cause mortality Paraguay: 2020 - 2022, Revista científica ciencias de la salud, 6, 1-7, https://doi.org/10.53732/rccsalud/2024.e6155.

title: Monthly street crime — py_streetcrime
text: py_streetcrime data frame 1248 rows 11 columns. observations monthly counts five typical street crimes theft, aggravated theft, robbery, aggravated robbery, aggravated robbery resulting death time series. data correspond Asuncion (central branch) respective branches (barrial1, barrial2 etc.), well cities Concepcion, Encarnacion, Ciudad del Este. definitions crimes according Paraguayan Penal Code. time series cover years 2014 2021. data set used published paper analyzing street crime first total lockdown COVID-19 pandemic era Paraguay.

title: Monthly street crime — py_streetcrime
text: data frame 1248 rows 11 variables: rowid index country Country name ISO Country ISO code branch Branch Public Ministry area Administrative area branch year_month Date variable %Y-%m-%d format theft Count value corresponding respective time period branch. theftagg Count value corresponding respective time period branch. robbery Count value corresponding respective time period branch. robberyagg Count value corresponding respective time period branch. robbery_death Count value corresponding respective time period branch.

title: Monthly street crime — py_streetcrime
text: Public Ministry (MP). https://www.ministeriopublico.gov.py/

title: Monthly street crime — py_streetcrime
text: Schneider, . (2024). Street crime COVID-19: retrospective comparison two Latin American capitals, Revista Paraguay desde las Ciencias Sociales, 14, 73-91, https://publicaciones.sociales.uba.ar/index.php/revistaparaguay/article/view/9800.

what: Weekly mean temperatures and holidays — py_temperature
title: Weekly mean temperatures and holidays — py_temperature
text: py_temperature data frame 1565 rows 7 columns. observations weekly average temperature data five largest Paraguayan cities 2016 2021. data set also includes indicator variable week holiday.

title: Weekly mean temperatures and holidays — py_temperature
Weekly mean temperatures and holidays — py_temperature
text: data frame 1565 rows 7 variables: rowid index country Country name ISO Country ISO code city Factor, city name week Week, Y%-m%-d% format avg_temp Average weekly temperature location holiday Dummy variable respective week holiday

title: Weekly mean temperatures and holidays — py_temperature
text: Visual Crossing. https://www.visualcrossing.com/

title: Daily weather data — py_weather
text: py_weather data frame 10945 rows 28 columns. observations daily weather conditions five largest Paraguayan cities 2016 2021.

title: Daily weather data — py_weather
text: data frame 10945 rows 28 variables: rowid index country Country name. ISO Country ISO code. city_name Character string city name. date Date, %Y-%m-%d format tempmax Maximum temperature location. tempmin Minimum temperature location. temp Temperature location. Daily values average values (mean) day. feelslikemax Maximum feels like temperature location. feelslikemin Minimum feels like temperature location. feelslike temperature feels like accounting heat index wind chill. Daily values average values (mean) day. dew Dew point temperature humidity Relative humidity % precip amount liquid precipitation fell predicted fall period. includes liquid-equivalent amount frozen precipitation snow ice. precipprob likelihood measurable precipitation ranging 0% 100% precipcover proportion hours non-zero precipitation. See windspeed sustained wind speed measured average wind speed occurs preceding one two minutes. Daily values maximum hourly value day. winddir Direction wind blowing. sealevelpressure sea level atmospheric barometric pressure millibars (hectopascals). cloudcover much sky covered cloud ranging 0-100%. visibility Distance distant objects visible. solarradiation solar radiation power instantaneous moment observation (forecast prediction). solarenergy indicates total energy sun builds hour day. uvindex value 0 10 indicating level ultra violet (UV) exposure hour day. 10 represents high level exposure, 0 represents exposure. sunrise formatted time sunrise (example “2022-05-23T05:50:40”). sunset formatted time sunset (example “2022-05-23T20:22:29”). moonphase Represents fractional portion current moon lunation cycle ranging 0 (new moon) 0.5 (full moon) back 1 (next new moon). conditions Textual representation weather conditions.

title: Daily weather data — py_weather
text: Visual Crossing. https://www.visualcrossing.com/

what: Weekly crimes of large Paraguayan cities — py_weekly_crime
title: Weekly crimes of large Paraguayan cities — py_weekly_crime
text: py_weekly_crime data frame 9390 rows 7 columns. observations weekly counts six different crime types theft, aggravated theft, robbery, aggravated robbery, domestic violence, land transit exposure (accidents). data correspond five largest Paraguayan cities moment data collection: Asuncion(capital), Ciudad del Este, Luque, San Lorenzo, Capiata. definitions crimes according Paraguayan Penal Code. time series cover years 2016 2021. data set used published paper analyzing street crime first total lockdown COVID-19 pandemic era Paraguay.

title: Weekly crimes of large Paraguayan cities — py_weekly_crime
Weekly crimes of large Paraguayan cities — py_weekly_crime
text: data frame 9390 rows 7 variables: rowid index country Country name character string ISO Country ISO code city Factor variable city name category Crime category, factor week Reference period. Weekly data, starting Monday crimes Count value corresponding respective time period category

title: Weekly crimes of large Paraguayan cities — py_weekly_crime
text: Public Ministry Paraguay (MP). https://www.ministeriopublico.gov.py/

title: Weekly crimes of large Paraguayan cities — py_weekly_crime
text: Schneider, . (2024). Street crime COVID-19: retrospective comparison two Latin American capitals, Revista Paraguay desde las Ciencias Sociales, 14, 73-91, https://publicaciones.sociales.uba.ar/index.php/revistaparaguay/article/view/9800.
